storyInfo: The Military Commission of Kazdel's airship fires the opening salvo of the war, and Norport Borough, having been separated from Londinium, bears the brunt of the coming storm. Reunion, led by Nine, is also moving towards Londinium with the goal of gathering strength.

attributes.text: New red wheat seeds, a burdenbeast saddle
\n\nMill operation unit, looking for previously owned
Two woolen coats, Swinton's tailorshop, dad's needs its hem trimmed short.
\n\n (crossed out) (I said, I forgot)
Grab some cheap candy to tide the kids over
\n\nAsk George if you can borrow his medal!

attributes.content: Piers.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Yes, Captain!
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: I heard your leave was approved.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Yes, I suppose it went rather well. It's all thanks to...
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: It's all thanks to that babyface of yours, lad.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: The brass occasionally want to put up a facade of caring about their subordinates. They call it good branding.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Haha, I guess the brass happened to be in a good mood.
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: The mill back home stopped working and the old carpenter there broke his leg again, so my mother asked me home to help out.
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: Ten days of leave, minus eight days on the road. A day and a half is more than enough for me to deal with that rickety antique!
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: I left an extra half-day open, just in case my dad needs help tilling the other part of the field.
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: Oh right, I should pick up another dozen work gloves. The ones back home are past their prime.
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: Hmm. Is this... a shopping list?
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: That's right, Captain. Just so nothing is missing. I don't know when I'm going to get time off again.
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: Hopefully you've earned yourself a real medal or two by then.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Of course. All for Victoria!
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: That's the kind of ambition I want to see, lad.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: I once knew a bloke named Todd. He and I fought against those Spire Casters out on the frontier, and he earned himself a solid gold medal.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: What a beautiful thing that was, glittering as it hung on his chest. It shone so brightly nobody could take their eyes off it.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Our beloved Duke Windermere personally awarded him the medal, which is the highest of honors for any soldier. But, at the celebration banquet later on, old Todd had a bitter look on his face.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Can you guess why?
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Because he wasn't satisfied with the merits he earned?
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: No, no. It's much worse than that.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: He couldn't lift his mug to take a swig of beer. His hands got replaced with a pair of wooden prosthetics, hah!
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: The veteran officer grins, showing a mouthful of yellowed teeth.
The young soldier laughs dryly. He knows this is one of the officer's many poor jokes.
The wind is so strong on the deck that the soldier has to hold on to the brim of his hat, letting out a loud yet harmless sneeze.
No matter the season or weather, standing on the deck of a prancing high-speed battleship always makes one want to wrap himself in his coat.
The young soldier thinks to himself– Wells is in charge today; how many cans of rations did that pudgy, bald man swipe?
But, the creamy vegetable chowder he makes is without equal, and if fortune is on his side, that old bastard might even throw in a healthy serving of fowlbeast into the soup.
He figures that he should leave after the sun sets and he finishes dinner.
The mobile fortress they're stationed in has already reached Londinium's vicinity. When the weather is clear, they can even see the pinnacle of The Shard on the horizon.
After returning to the station, he'd board the logistics squad's transport vehicle and head to the nearest town first, where he'd be able to have a drink or two at the tavern.
In the early morning, there'd be cobblers heading into town to sell their wares. Two boxes of tobacco would let them hitch a ride.
The young soldier recalls those barns from back home, always filled with the fermented smell of composted straw.
Even now, that smell occasionally wafts to him in his dreams, making him want to pinch his nose. But at the same time, it represents a connection with his hometown.
If it only occurs occasionally, then so be it. He furrows his brows quietly, deciding not to continue deluding himself with these sentiments.
Even if it's only occasional, he doesn't want to experience that stench again. He must admit, that is always the biggest impediment every time he returns home.
Ugh, the fog's rising again. I'll never get used to Londinium's bloody weather.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Wasn't much better when we were stationed at Leithanien's outskirts, but at least you could enjoy a little sunshine in the afternoon.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Go. Tell the Captain, we can't see a thing at this weather observation outpost. Something's interfering with the radar too. We should head back.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Caster's forces are obediently maintaining formation, Gododdin moved his men further back. Other than the few familiar faces in the forward team, old Wellington's main force still hasn't shown up.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Other than our dear Duke Windermere, the remaining seven dukes are watching on from the sidelines. The patrol's over.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Sir, that Sarkaz...
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: None of our business. The brass always have their own agenda.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: But, I heard that Londinium's...
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: Piers, I've been a soldier for over a decade. After drinking and playing cards, the most important thing I've picked up from being in the army is–
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Those rumors you hear are always bunkum and balderdash. Never pay any heed to them. The officers in the back have their eyes on the map and will take care of everything; ours is but to do and die.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Isn't it our duty... to defend Victoria?
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: Only they can decide what Victoria is, boy. Our job is simply to follow orders.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Go and head back. Our day of peace is over.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: I ought to treat myself to a hot shower. This damn fog's making my bones ache.
attributes.name: Veteran Officer

attributes.content: Maybe things have been too stressful these days. The young soldier begins to thank himself for taking some time off to unwind.
The battlefield always puts people on edge, even more so when you don't know where the when or where war will break out, or who you can trust.
He thinks to himself, it's a bit clammy.
He lifts his hand to undo the first button of his shirt. Seeing as how his dear officer had just declared the end of the armistice, a little disregard for protocol shouldn't matter.

He thinks of the fireplace back home. A few years ago, he came home wearing a brand-new military outfit, unwilling to undo even a single button despite sweating profusely from the heat of hearth. For that, the young lass Shirley laughed at him for quite some time.
The young soldier curls the corner of his lips.
Heh. That's why I didn't bring you your sappy romance novel. Payback.
attributes.name: Young Soldier

attributes.content: Main cannon output is normal. Confirming target destroyed.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Begin preparations for the next phase. The dukes will react soon.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Your Highness.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Y-Your Highness!
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Hmm, a new face?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Y-Yes! Your Highness, I was just promoted from the mercenary unit by the General!
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: It... It is the greatest honor... You've always been my...
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: It's an honor to make your acquaintance as well. What is your name?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: My name... My name is...
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: (whispers) I don't have a formal name... They just call me 'Elbow.'
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Uhh... Damn, I should've picked a name from a book.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: 'Elbow'... Why that name?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It's nothing, I just got burnt when I was drinking soup... I mean, it's a stupid story, hardly worth your attention, Your Highness...
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: You must've been holding your bowl too high.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: No! It was 'Plug'! That bastard ran into me! The next time I see him, I swear...
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Your Highness.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Oh, I... I'm sorry, General, Your Highness.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: You may leave. It seems you still have a lot of work to do.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I heard they're serving creamy vegetable chowder at the airship garrison tonight. Don't miss supper time.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Thank you, Your Highness Theresa.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: We...
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: 'When each battle ends, the Sarkaz have a home to return to.'
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: We'll be able to return to Kazdel soon, right?
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I prefer to be with them rather than with the aristocrats of the Royal Court.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Each and every moment, the collective souls of the Sarkaz force me to my knees, immersing me in our long and painful history.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But they... these newly-grown children, give me a tangible sense of the future.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: And... what should we do with this future? Consign it to another round of wars sweeping across the land?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: When scorched earth spreads as far as the eye can see, will these new seedlings sprout as we hope?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Hope is as weighty as ever, Manfred.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your Highness...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: In accordance with the Military Commission's plans, a section of Londinium has been detached. As of right now, it has arrived at the designated location, parked between the main city and the dukes' encirclement.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: It will become the cornerstone and launchpad of our next offensive, and this airship will also temporarily dock there.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: The Duke of Windermere should soon receive news that her high-speed battleship has been destroyed, but she also cannot ignore the threat this airship poses, which in turn will help the Nachzehrer King's front develop.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: In accordance with the Regent's instructions, we must next...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Take a look outside, General.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Manfred turns to look out the window.
He is forced to admit that the carefully-planned flames burning before his eyes are... not as exhilarating as he had imagined.
The firelight is blinding.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Our war has finally broken out.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: According to the Military Commission's projections, the dukes will cautiously proceed with military operations within sixteen hours. We have already made our preparations.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: No, the war never ended.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It is not only ranks ripping through other ranks that is worthy of the name of war. Those eyes lurking behind the curtains, those curses whispered in the dead of night, those suppressed cries... are all war.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Those compatriots who perished alone in the barrens, those robes dragged across the ground during the Black Processions, those Kazdel bricks and tiles sealed away in a collector's glass display case... are also all war.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: War has always been a part of us. We simply... pushed it out for all to see once again.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Even if the flames of war were ignited in Victoria, Kazdel has always been a part of the battlefield. I've already made many plans with the General about this...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: No, Manfred, that's not what I was asking.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I simply observed that beneath our feet, the shadow of this airship covers all indiscriminately.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Put an end to it, General. If this ultimately is proven to be the only way for the Sarkaz...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Then, drown tears with tears, and bury suffering with suffering.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: This... is the only way.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I will carry out your will, Your Highness.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You see that?
attributes.name: Uneasy Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: No mistake about it. Looks like it came straight out of a storybook.
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: The harbinger of destruction. The prophet of turmoil. Nightmare given form...
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: So...
attributes.name: Uneasy Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: You ever see that gloompincer as big as a mountain, lugging along its chest of perfume?
attributes.name: Uneasy Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: Yup, just like Red-Nosed Humbert talked about.
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: Nine said before, you're in no condition to be drinking.
attributes.name: Uneasy Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: I only had a sip! I don't have much time left. Leave me with my last bit of hope!
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: You still remember that night on the snowfield, right? Everyone was freezing to death, and Red-Nosed Humbert told us about a strange legend from his village–
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: Sorry... I signed on in Victoria.
attributes.name: Uneasy Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: Oh really? I thought...
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: Yeah, Red-Nosed Humbert died back in Ursus. He was a good guy, took at least four of those Patrol Unit bastards with him.
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: Damn it, you would've appreciated him and his stories. Gotta pour one out for him.
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: You're drunk again, Romanich. How many times do I have to tell you? Hand over the flagon.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Ma'am, I don't have much longer to live, c'mon...
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: You've still got a long life ahead of you, if you listen to the doctor.
attributes.name: Nine
Crippled Reunion Fighter
attributes.content: I, I hate doctors! They're all liars, all of 'em!

attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter
attributes.content: I need these fluids... They let me see... (mutters softly)...
He's asleep again.
attributes.name: Uneasy Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: Toss him a blanket.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: We can't be too far from Londinium now.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Yeah. If we're lucky, we'll be able to see those city walls in just over a week. It'd be faster if we could fix that piece-of-junk car.
attributes.name: Uneasy Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: You don't see Catastrophes too often around Londinium, but given the current situation, it's virtually impossible not to bump into any of the dukes' troops. And none of 'em are gonna welcome us.
attributes.name: Uneasy Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: Then, throw the Sarkaz on top...
attributes.name: Uneasy Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: We need to be even more cautious during our subsequent operations.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: We need to find our trapped people, whether they still think they're our people or not.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Getting everyone back together is difficult... but, we still feel the same pain and share the same sorrow. Those feelings never stop chasing us, and they force us to keep moving forward.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I'm not saying that just to cope, but... this is the only thing we can do with full peace of mind–
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Let those Infected on the verge of despair know that they still have comrades out there, and that their lives aren't disposable.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Stay where you belong.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Talulah.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Nine.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I'm just getting a breath of fresh air.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Fine. I have my eye on you.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Flames are burning... Out there, in the distance.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: They've been burning for some time now. Hopefully, it's just a patch of woods struck by lightning.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Our squad will cross over.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Lightning, huh...?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I saw you were making stew back at camp.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I was just helping out the cook. She still had two baskets of potatoes to get through.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I gave it a taste. Wasn't too bad.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Alina... I mean, an old friend once taught me a few things.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I thought I had forgotten it all.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: If you're still willing to play a part before facing justice, I won't stop you.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: But, you'd best remember who you are, Talulah. We'll be watching you. All of us.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: ...I know.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Start packing up. It's time to go.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Huh? I fell asleep? Damn it...
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: C'mon, Nine! Take pity on this old man and let me have another sip! Otherwise, I'm as good as dead today!
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: Bah! Did you see that? The edge of the sky's blood red! Red-Nosed Humbert said...
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: He said that's a good omen... A good omen, I tell you!
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: He said that was... the other shore? Victory? Uhh, I don't exactly remember...
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: Maybe, maybe...
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter

attributes.content: Maybe it means... Tomorrow will be a good day, my friends.
attributes.name: Crippled Reunion Fighter
